Transportation would become more sustainable and eco-friendly as bicycles do not emit pollutants and require less energy to produce.
The air would become cleaner and healthier as the number of cars on the road would decrease, reducing air pollution and noise pollution.
Cities would become more bike-friendly, with more bike lanes and infrastructure, making it easier for people to commute and travel.
People would become more physically active as they would have to rely on bicycles for transportation, leading to a healthier population.
The economy would shift towards bicycle production and maintenance, creating new jobs and industries.
